required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Sequential Fluoroscopy Guidance With Spiral Guidance in Terms of Safety, Effectiveness, Speed and Radiation in Interventional Chest-abdomen-pelvic Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Study Was to Compare Sequential Fluoroscopy Guidance With Spiral Guidance in Terms of Safety (Number of Major Complications), Effectiveness (Number of Targets Reached), Speed (Procedural Time) and Radiation (DLP) in Interventional Chest-abdomen-pelvic Procedures.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to compare sequential fluoroscopy guidance with spiral guidance in terms of safety (number of major complications), effectiveness (number of targets reached), speed (procedural time) and radiation (DLP) in interventional chest-abdomen-pelvic procedures.

primary_outcome.time_frame: All patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control performed on a period of 1 year will be taken into account
All patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control performed on a period of 1 year will be taken into account
All patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control performed on a period of 1 year will be taken into account

secondary_outcome.measure: number of controls required to place the needle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control performed on a period of 1 year will be taken into account

intervention.intervention_name: Patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control
intervention.description: Not applicable, all patients with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control on a period of 1 year will be taken into account

study_pop.textblock: Patient with indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients (> 18 years),
- indication of interventional percutaneous diagnostic or therapeutic chest-abdomen-pelvic procedure under CT control
Exclusion Criteria:
- MRI contra indication
- persons referred to in Articles L1121-5 to L1121-8 of the French Public Health Code
